review_title: Great Work Environment Poor Pay and Benefits
job_title: Advisor in East Hartford, CT
pros: Great work environment. I love all of the people that I work with. They can be flexible with schedule (sometimes).
cons:
Pay is awful - full time employee with 5+ years experience with a bachelors degree making 38k. 
Benefits - the health insurance is poor and not accepted everywhere.
PTO - they have months and months and months where you are unable to take off time regardless of the reason. 
Communication between management is awful. The majority of the people don't know what you do and why you are important. 
No room for growth.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in East Hartford, CT
pros: Diverse and challenging student body allows instructors to use a variety of techniques for presentation of course material that will be useful to different  student audiences.
cons: Many students lack study skills and motivation.  Some have trouble with reading and discussing textbook assignments. Research is even more difficult.

job_title: Applicant Advisor in East Hartford, CT
pros: There is an opportunity for employee to get further educational benefits and as an advisor I get a change to change lives for a brief moment
cons: Management is all over the place, don't listen to their staff, and tend to hire base off of who they like and who they are friends with

job_title: Admissions Officer in East Hartford, CT
pros: The overall vision of the college, to provide an education to a segment of our society that would not be able to go to school otherwise.
cons: Their technology for doing your job is outdated. The compensation is not at par with the rest of the industry

job_title: Peer Academic Tutor in South Windsor, CT
pros: Great place to work; people are friendly and welcoming; and strive to provide the best work & study environment possible. Administration takes care of their employees and students as if they are family.
cons: Not all students are respectful of staff, fellow students and the environment. Occasionally favoritism was displayed among staff and students.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Hartford, CT
pros: A great culture filled with friendly, hardworking and caring individuals. Goodwin really puts the customer (student) at the center of everything they do which is why they have excelled.
cons: Working for a private college isn't always the most lucrative career choice.

job_title: Professor in East Hartford, CT
pros: If you like being treated like pond scum, this place is for you.
cons: Terrible pay.  No offices -- you work in a bullpen.  Most students have no business being in college, yet you are pressured to not fail them.  Five course per term load and summers are included for no additional pay.  Low morale and duplicitous management.

job_title: Admissions Officer in East Hartford, CT
pros: Good position for students straight out of college looking to develop admissions and recruiting experience
cons: Poor long-term development model and lack of department direction

job_title: in East Hartford, CT
pros: Coworkers are friendly and the campus is pretty.
cons: High stress environment.  Very few people take responsibility for their actions.  Senior management often decides to do things without consulting the proper people.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Medford, MA
pros: Co-workers were friendly and helpful
